content.description: Start all the way on the lowest and leftmost part of the boulder on the side to the left of Harold's Boulder. Traverse across the boulder to the right without using ANY parts of the top of the boulder until you can reach the highest point. My favorite climb in the area, very techy and balancy.
content.location: On the furthest side of the larger boulder at the top of Kincaid woods.

content.description: Start on the right most end of the closer side of the larger boulder (in between the rocks). Traverse across using any and all holds or go straight up on any portion of the rock for a solid warm up.
content.location: Closer side of larger boulder at the top of Kincaid Woods.

content.description: Sit start low on the left side of the Stegosaurus boulder, with both hands on a sloped edge. Move right around the boulder with left heel hooks and longish moves until you get to the two jugs, then top out. Only using the holds on/under the lip (to get to Stegosaurus starting holds) is a much harder variation

Start with your feet all the way at the bottom of the overhang in the smaller boulder, your left hand in a crack right above the lip, and your right hand on a sloping piece of rock on the lip. Jump up about 2-3 feet to a jug with your left hand, make another move to a jug off to the right, then pull yourself up. Super fun and cool looking moves.
content.location: Smaller boulder at the top of Kincaid Woods.

content.description: Start on the slopey lip and head straight up into some small and sharp holds. Move up the face, right arete off.

Start with your left hand on the hold in the overhang and your right hand above the lip in a jug. After a series of dynamic moves to the shelf, make your way up without using the arete. Named after a sweet old man named Harold who joyfully watched as I put up the FA.
content.location: The largest rock you see at the top of Kincaid woods.

content.description: Potential for a higher grade problem with a lower/sit start. Start with your left hand on the lip where you put your right hand for Harold’s Razors. Start with your right hand out to a jug, move up past the lip and up the arete.
content.location: Upper Boulders in Kincaid woods. Corner of the biggest boulder.

content.description: This area features a 15-20 foot cliff that I have barely climbed because there is a bad landing, should be fine with a couple more pads. There's also a few gigantic erratic boulders. The problems that begin in the overhangs have the potential to become higher number grades with a sit start/lower moves.
